description: LLM context data for parameter extraction and feature guidance (consolidated from product_names.json + category_features_llm.json)

USAGE_GUIDE.purpose: Provides LLM-consumable context for parameter extraction and feature guidance. This data is fed to OpenAI GPT-4 prompts.
loaded_by: parameter_extractor.py - Loads product_names for fuzzy matching in LLM prompts
message_generator.py - Loads category_features for intelligent feature guidance
what_it_controls: Product name lists used in fuzzy matching (helps LLM recognize product names)
Category feature metadata (specs, capabilities, key features)
Feature guidance text shown to users after product searches
LLM prompt context for better parameter extraction
USAGE_GUIDE.why_separate_from_component_types: This data goes INTO LLM prompts (token-consuming), while component_types.json is system configuration (not sent to LLM)

adding_product_names.step_1: Add product name to appropriate component array in product_names section
adding_product_names.step_2: Use exact product names from Neo4j database (item_name property)
adding_product_names.step_4: Keep lists updated when new products added to Neo4j
adding_product_names.note: Only enabled components are loaded (see component_types.json fuzzy_matching_enabled)

updating_category_features.numeric_specs: Add min/max/value ranges with units for measurable properties
updating_category_features.categorical_features: Add dropdown-style options (e.g., Cooling Type: Water/Air)
updating_category_features.capabilities: Add supported processes, compatibility info, performance specs
updating_category_features.key_features: Add marketing highlights, unique selling points, differentiators
updating_category_features.guidance: Pre-formatted text shown to users - use emojis and bullet points for readability

category_naming.use_snake_case: Category keys must match component_types.json keys (power_source, feeder, cooler, etc.)
category_naming.display_name: Use proper capitalization for UI display
category_naming.consistency: Keep category names in sync with component_types.json to avoid manual mapping

guidance_text_format.structure: Use sections: üìã Header, üî¢ Specifications, üè∑Ô∏è Options, ‚ö° Capabilities, ‚ú® Key Features
guidance_text_format.emojis: Use consistent emojis per section for visual recognition
guidance_text_format.bullets: Use ‚Ä¢ for bullet points, format: 'Property: Value'
guidance_text_format.multilingual_note: Currently guidance is English-only - consider dynamic generation for i18n in future

IMPORTANT_NOTES.consolidation_history: Nov 15, 2024 - Consolidated product_names.json + category_features_llm.json into this file for clear LLM context separation
IMPORTANT_NOTES.token_management: This file content is included in LLM prompts - keep it concise to manage token costs
IMPORTANT_NOTES.architecture: LLM context (this file) is separate from system config (component_types.json, search_config.json)
IMPORTANT_NOTES.data_source: Product names come from Neo4j database. Category features are LLM-extracted from product database analysis.
sync_requirements: Product names should match Neo4j item_name properties
Category keys should match component_types.json component keys
Update when new products added to Neo4j
future_improvements: Auto-generate product_names from Neo4j queries (eliminate manual sync)
Extract category_features from Neo4j schema inspection
related_configs: component_types.json - Defines which components use fuzzy matching
search_config.json - Fuzzy matching algorithm and thresholds
